Header: Mirijjawila shooting: Car driver to be produced for an identification parade
Content: The driver of the car who is allegedly linked with the murder of a passenger inside a bus in Mirijjawila, Hambantota recently was ordered to be produced for an identification parade. The order was issued by Hambantota Chief Magistrate Manjula Karunaratne yesterday (Mar. 01). Until the identification parade is held, the suspect has been remanded until 14th of March. The suspect who had obtained the car for rent was arrested in Eheliyagoda by a police team. The suspect had told police that after obtaining the car from a woman in Eheliyagoda for rent, he had given it to three others. On 26th of last month, an unidentified gunman shot and killed a passenger inside an Amparai bound bus in Mirijjawila, Hambantota. The deceased was returning to Athimale with his wife after attending a court case in Tangalle. After killing him, the gunman had alighted from the bus and fled the area in the car which was apprehended later in Eheliyagoda.
